page.title: 08FARMER'S WIFE'S ROLE-SESSAY
page.content: {Mechanisation}has greatly altered the life of a farmer's wife since the 1930s. Domestic appliances make light work of household tasks and cars make it easy to purchase most foods ready- prepared, instead of spending hours baking. Some{traditional tasks}such as keeping geese and butter- and cheese-making are now undergoing a small revival, but a modern farmer's wife is more likely to be engaged in providing farm holidays. However, some wives directly support their husbands' endeavours - tractor-driving during harvest and potato picking. At{"Pick Your Own" farms,}wives spend long hours in the farm shop. Further, complex systems of farm finance, EEC marketing and the need for up-to-date accurate financial and productive data entails much paperwork often dealt with by the farmer's wife.
